$ul: **data**
**completed_at**: ISO 8601 formatted date indicating when the message was finalized.
**cost**
**amount**: The amount deducted from your account.
**currency**: The ISO 4217 currency identifier.
**direction**: The direction of the message. Inbound messages are sent to you whereas outbound messages are sent from you.
**encoding**: Encoding scheme used for the message body.
**errors**: These errors may point at addressees when referring to unsuccessful/unconfirmed delivery statuses.
**from**
**carrier**: The carrier of the receiver.
**line_type**: The line-type of the receiver.
**phone_number**: Sending address (+E.164 formatted phone number, alphanumeric sender ID, or short code).
**id**: Identifies the type of resource.
**media**
**messaging_profile_id**: Unique identifier for a messaging profile.
**organization_id**: The id of the organization the messaging profile belongs to.
**parts**: Number of parts into which the message's body must be split.
**received_at**: ISO 8601 formatted date indicating when the message request was received.
**record_type**: Identifies the type of the resource.
**sent_at**: ISO 8601 formatted date indicating when the message was sent.
**subject**: Subject of multimedia message
**tags**: Tags associated with the resource.
**text**: Message body (i.e., content) as a non-empty string.
**type**: The type of message.
**valid_until**: Message must be out of the queue by this time or else it will be discarded and marked as 'sending_failed'. Once the message moves out of the queue, this field will be nulled
**webhook_failover_url**: The failover URL where webhooks related to this message will be sent if sending to the primary URL fails.
**webhook_url**: The URL where webhooks related to this message will be sent.
**errors**
